Detailed Description

BtDeviceList is used to get access to the Bluetooth Devices stored in the Bluetooth Stack. Because the list in the Bluetooth Stack can change over time through finding new devices on the air, changing device properties or deleting devices, the instantiated list is a snapshot of the list stored in the Bluetooth Stack at the point of time, when it was created.
There are two constructors for this class. The first one creates an empty BtDeviceList and, if the paramter do_refresh is set to TRUE, reads all Bluetooth Devices from the Bluetooth Stack, which match the passed BtDeviceFilter and stores them in the newly created list. The second constructor (copy constructor) is used to create a copy of an existing list. The parameter device_filter is used to constrain the number of elements that are copied (e.g.: you can copy out all device that are conneted by passing the apropriate filter).
When the list stored in the Bluetooth Stack changes, there are messages sent to the applications. As a reaction to these messages the function Refresh can be called to synchronize the instance of the BtDeviceList with the list stored in the Bluetooth Stack.
Attention: References to BtDevice-objects within the BtDeviceList can become invalid by the execution of this function, because it is possible that objects stored in the list will be deleted.
Attention: Inserted elements will be copied!

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BtDeviceList::BtDeviceList (  BOOLEAN  do_refresh = FALSE,
const BtDeviceFilter &  device_filter = BtDeviceFilter()
)  [explicit]
 

Constructor (default constructor).

BtDeviceList is the default constructor. Depending on the do_refresh parameter an empty list is created or the new list is filled with all Bluetooth Devices stored in the Bluetooth Stack that match the passed BtDeviceFilter.

Parameters:
do_refresh A BOOLEAN that instructs the constructor either to add BT-Devices stored in the BT-Stack or not.
device_filter A reference to a BtDeviceFilter that filters the BT-Devices from the BT-Stack when they are added.

BtDeviceList::BtDeviceList (  const BtDeviceList &  device_list,
const BtDeviceFilter &  device_filter = BtDeviceFilter()
)  [explicit]
 

Constructor (copy constructor).

BtDeviceList is the copy constructor. All BtDevices, that match the device_filter will be copied from the device_list.

Parameters:
device_list A reference to a BtDeviceList, whose BtDevices should be copied.
device_filter A reference to a BtDeviceFilter that is used to determine whether a BtDevice should be copied or not.

BtDeviceList::~BtDeviceList (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Get the last element of the list.

Back returns a reference to the last BtDevice of this BtDeviceList, which must be non-empty

Returns:
A reference to a constant BtDevice that is the last element in the BtDeviceList.

BtDeviceListConstantIterator BtDeviceList::Begin (   )  const
 

Get an itertator pointing to the first element in the list.

Begin returns a BtDeviceListConstantIterator that points at the first BtDevice of the BtDeviceList or beyond-the-end of an empty BtDeviceList.

Returns:
BtDeviceListIterator An iterator pointing to the first element in the list.
End() The list is empty

BtDeviceListIterator BtDeviceList::Erase (  BtDeviceListIterator  first,
BtDeviceListIterator  last
) 
 

Erase a specified range of elements from the list.

Erase removes all BtDevices in the range [first,last(. The operation returns a BtDeviceListIterator that points to the first BtDevice beyond the last removedBtDevice or the past-the-end iterator, if the last removed BtDevice was also the last element in the BtDeviceList.

Parameters:
first A reference to a BtDeviceListIterator that contains the first position of the sequence of BtDevices, which should be deleted.
last A reference to a BtDeviceListIterator that contains the last position of the sequence of BtDevices, which should be deleted.
Returns:
BtDeviceListIterator An iterator pointing to the element following the the last element that has been deleted.
End() The passed in iterator last pointed to the last element in the list.

BtDeviceListIterator BtDeviceList::Erase (  BtDeviceListIterator  iterator  ) 
 

Erase an element at a specified positin from the list.

Erase removes the BtDevice of the the BtDeviceList pointed to by the BtDeviceListIterator. The operation returns a BtDeviceListIterator that points to the first BtDevice beyond the removed BtDevice or the past-the-end iterator, if the BtDeviceListIterator pointing at the BtDevice to delete, represents the last element of the list.

Parameters:
iterator A reference to a BtDeviceListIterator containing the position where to remove the BtDevice.
Returns:
BtDeviceListIterator An iterator pointing to the element following the the element that has been deleted.
End() The passed in iterator pointed to the last element in the list.

void BtDeviceList::Filter (  const BtDeviceFilter &  device_filter  ) 
 

Clear elements not maching a filter condition.

Filter deletes all BtDevices from this BtDeviceList that do not match the passed in BtDeviceFilter.
Attention: Iterators and references to BtDevices stored in this BtDeviceList may become invalid.

Parameters:
device_filter A reference to a BtDeviceFilter, which all elements in the resulting BtDeviceList will match.

BtDeviceListConstantIterator BtDeviceList::Find (  const BtDeviceAddress &  device_address  )  const
 

Search for a specific address.

Find searches the BtDeviceList for the existance of the passed in BtDeviceAddress and retuns a BtDeviceListIterator that contains the position of the searched BtDevice or the past-the-end iterator, if the BtDeviceList does not contain the searched BtDeviceAddress.

Parameters:
device_address A reference to a BtDeviceAddress that should be found in the BtDeviceList.
Returns:
BtDeviceListIterator An iterator containing the position of the element within the list.
End() The element is not contained in the list.

BtDeviceListIterator BtDeviceList::Find (  const BtDeviceAddress &  device_address  )

Find searches the BtDeviceList for the existance of the passed in BtDeviceAddress and retuns a BtDeviceListIterator that contains the position of the searched BtDevice or the past-the-end iterator, if the BtDeviceList does not contain the searched BtDeviceAddress.

Parameters:
device_address A reference to a BtDeviceAddress that should be found in the BtDeviceList.
Returns:
BtDeviceListIterator An iterator containing the position of the element within the list.
End() The element is not contained in the list.

Get the number of elements stored in the list.

GetSize returns the number of BtDevices stored in the BtDeviceList

A UINT8 containing the number of BtDevices.

BtDeviceListIterator BtDeviceList::Insert (  BtDeviceListIterator  iterator,
const BtDevice &  device
) 
 

Insert an element at a specified position into the list.

Insert inserts the passed BtDevice before the element pointed to by the BtDeviceListIterator and returns a BtDeviceListIterator containing the position of the newly inserted BtDevice.

Parameters:
iterator A reference to a BtDeviceListIterator containing the position where to insert the new BtDevice.
device A reference to the BtDevice that should be inserted at the position the BtDeviceListIterator is pointing to.
Returns:
BtDeviceListIterator An iterator pointing to the position in the list where the new element was inserted
End() The insert operation failed

BOOLEAN BtDeviceList::IsEmpty (   )  const
 

Is the list empty?

IsEmpty returns whether there are BtDeviceLists in the BtDeviceList or not.

Returns:
TRUE: The BtDeviceList contains no BtDevices.
FALSE: The BtDeviceList contains BtDevices.

Remove the element at the end of the list.

PopBack removes the last element oft the BtDeviceList, which must be non-empty.

void BtDeviceList::PopFront (   ) 
 

Remove the element at the beginning of the list.

PopFront removes the first element oft the BtDeviceList, which must be non-empty.

Append element at the end of the list.

PushBack inserts a BtDevice at the and of the BtDeviceList.

Parameters:
device A reference to a BtDevice that should be inserted at the end of the BtDeviceList.

void BtDeviceList::PushFront (  const BtDevice &  device  ) 
 

Append element at the beginning of the list.

PushFront inserts a BtDevice at the beginning of the BtDeviceList.

Parameters:
device A reference to a BtDevice that should be inserted at the beginning of the BtDeviceList.

BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator BtDeviceList::RBegin (   )  const
 

Get an iterator pointing to the first element of the reverted list.

RBegin returns a BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator that points to the last BtDevice of the BtDeviceList or before-the-beginning of an empty BtDeviceList. Hence, it designates the beginning of the reverse BtDeviceList.

Returns:
BtDeviceListReverseIterator An iterator pointing to the first element in the reverted list.
End() The list is empty

BtDeviceListReverseIterator BtDeviceList::RBegin (   ) 
 

Get an iterator pointing to the first element of the reverted list.

RBegin returns a BtDeviceListReverseIterator that points to the last BtDevice of the BtDeviceList or before-the-beginning of an empty BtDeviceList. Hence, it designates the beginning of the reverse BtDeviceList.

Returns:
BtDeviceListReverseIterator An iterator pointing to the first element in the reverted list.
End() The list is empty

void BtDeviceList::Refresh (  const BtDeviceFilter &  device_filter = BtDeviceFilter()  ) 
 

Synchonize list with Bluetooth Stack.

Refresh synchronizes this BtDeviceList with the list of BT-Devices stored in the BT-Stack. Sychnronize means that the list is not destroyed and built up new. It means that objects are inserted and deleted according to the list stored in the BT-Stack. After the operation only elements matching the passed BtDeviceFilter are in the list.
Attention: Iterators and references to BtDevices stored in this BtDeviceList may become invalid.

Parameters:
device_filter A reference to a BtDeviceFilter, which all elements in the resulting BtDeviceList will match.

void BtDeviceList::Remove (  const BtDevice &  device  ) 
 

Remove a specified element from the list.

Remove searches the BtDeviceList for the occurance of the passed BtDevice and if found, removes it.

Parameters:
device A reference to a BtDevice that shoud be deleted from the BtDeviceList.

BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator BtDeviceList::REnd (   )  const
 

Get an itertator pointing beyond-the-end of the reverted list.

REnd returns a BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator that points before-the-beginning of the BtDeviceList. Hence, it designates the end of the reverse sequence.

Returns:
A BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator that points just beyond-the-end of the reverse order of the BtDeviceList.

BtDeviceListReverseIterator BtDeviceList::REnd (   ) 
 

Get an itertator pointing beyond-the-end of the reverted list.

REnd returns a BtDeviceListReverseIterator that points before-the-beginning of the BtDeviceList. Hence, it designates the end of the reverse sequence.

Returns:
A BtDeviceListReverseIterator that points just beyond-the-end of the reverse order of the BtDeviceList.
